programme.desc: Jack breaks a date with Janet to coach a nervous Larry, who's hoping to romance Terri with smooth conversation.

programme.desc: Terri and Jack believe that Janet will have to make it with her dance instructor if she wants to make it as a dancer.

programme.desc: Helen and her sisters are shocked by their elderly mother wanting to have a 'wake' for herself. She invites others to say goodbye in advance. Also, Jeffrey throws his back out and is trapped in a chair.

programme.desc: The Brookes are expecting a Congressman to drop by and Jeffrey doesn't want the Ropers around when he comes.

programme.desc: Henry hires Monroe as his assistant after Monroe is rejected for every post-college job he applies for.

programme.desc: On her way to China, Muriel's natural mother pays a visit to the Rush household, but Muriel refuses to meet her.

programme.desc: Christian asks Bannister for a favour when he learns that his mother is coming for a surprise visit.

programme.title: Check It Out

programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.desc: Word of a new gold mine prompts Bannister to convince Edna to investigate their life savings.

programme.desc: Susan wants to go away for her and Ben's wedding anniversary. Nick wins a car in a poker game. Michael finds some underwear.

programme.desc: It's Ben's birthday, and Janey comes for a visit with a friend.

programme.desc: Janey goes to university in Manchester, and an all out battle ensues over her room.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen really wants an electric organ but Stanley won't pay for one. Anne has an emergency and asks Helen to do her a favor by showing a buyer some property. An embarrassing situation may complicate things.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Jeffrey Brookes has a secret. His Uncle Bill is a free spirited "hobo" who has no interest in material things. To his horror, Bill shows up at his doorstep...but not before Stanley meets him and hires Bill to help around his place.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Running out of money, Stanley needs to take a job on the killing floor at his brother-in-law Hubert's meat packing plant. Later, his fortunes change when he learns Hubert is planning a secret trip to Acapulco with his secretary.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: When Stanley is being inattentive towards Helen, she decides to make him jealous by pretending to have an affair with the gardener. Both Anne and Jeffrey Brookes decide to help out and also hire some other guys to pose as Helen's lover.

programme.desc: Ethel tries to get a china horse, supposedly from the Ming Dynasty, away from Helen.

programme.desc: Mr. Roper decides to fix Jenny up with Brookes' nephew and Brookes freaks out upon learning about it.

programme.desc: Helen's and David's birthday party is a disaster when first Stanley and Jeffrey and then Helen and Anne start squabbling.

programme.desc: Helen is convinced Stanley is having an affair when she sees him give a locket to another women.

programme.desc: Helen volunteers Stanley to babysit on his poker night.

programme.desc: Stanley fears Helen accidentally gave a box containing his girlie magazines to a church rummage sale.

programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy offer to babysit for Stanley Roper's parakeet in exchange for a couple of concert tickets.

programme.desc: A surprise birthday party for Jack is nearly spoiled when an old girlfriend turns up, ready to entice Jack back into her web.

programme.desc: Jack Tripper, a chef for all seasons, turns out to be quite a dish himself when he disguises himself as roommate Chrissy to skirt FBI agents on his trail.

programme.desc: Chrissy finds out that Jack has become a male escort and is running around with an older woman.

programme.desc: When the roommates meet their new landlord (played by new series star Don Knotts) they discover they have accidentally sold all his furniture, thinking it was the Ropers!

programme.desc: Chrissy gets a new job selling cosmetics door-to-door, and unexpectedly finds herself in Ralph Furley's winner-take-all strip poker game.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack's weekend at Larry's boss' secluded mountain lodge turns into a hilarious scramble for beds when Chrissy and Janet show up with a crowd.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: It's no more "Mr. Nice Guy" after Jack learns how to get his way with Chrissy and Janet.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: The trio's outrageous escapades result in an eviction notice from Furley and they get ready to move into a luxurious rent-free penthouse.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Nosey landlord Furley misunderstands when he overhears Jack and Chrissy laughing in the bathtub.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: 75-year-young veteran actor J. Pat O'Malley takes a lesson from the "youngsters" by forming his own "oldster-trio" in a geriatric apartment commune.
